Detailed Description

Factory used to create new patch levels.

New types of patch level objects can be introduced into SAMRAI by deriving from PatchLevelFactory and re-defining allocate.

See also:
hier::PatchLevel

boost::shared_ptr< PatchLevel > SAMRAI::hier::PatchLevelFactory::allocate ( const boost::shared_ptr< tbox::Database > &  database,
const boost::shared_ptr< BaseGridGeometry > &  grid_geometry,
const boost::shared_ptr< PatchDescriptor > &  descriptor,
const ComponentSelector &  component_selector,
const boost::shared_ptr< PatchFactory > &  factory = boost::shared_ptr< PatchFactory >(),
const bool  defer_boundary_box_creation = false 
) const [virtual]

Allocate a patch level using the data from the database to initialize it.

The component_selector argument is used to specify which patch data components to allocate and read in from the database.

Note:
If desired, pass a ComponentSelector with all bits set to false to indicate that no patch data components are read/allocated.
Redefine this function to change the method for creating patch levels from a database.

Returns:
A boost::shared_ptr to the newly created PatchLevel.
Parameters:
[in] database 
[in] grid_geometry 
[in] descriptor 
[in] component_selector 
[in] factory Default: a boost::shared_ptr to the standard PatchFactory
[in] defer_boundary_box_creation Default: false
